In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is how you can solve this problem using Julia programming language:

First, we need to import the DataFrame package.
```julia
using DataFrames
```
Then define your function `add_yearmonth`:
```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df[:dt])
    return df
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame `df` and creates a new column named `:ym`. For each row in the DataFrame, it extracts the year (`Dates.year(x)`) and month (`Dates.month(x)`) from the DateTime value stored in the `:dt` column, and then combines them into a single integer.

Here is how you can use this function:
```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2021, 1, 1), DateTime(2022, 2, 29), DateTime(2023, 3, 31)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will add a new column `:ym` to the DataFrame `df`. The value of this column in the first row would be 202101 (because January 2021 is the 202101), and so on.
